page.title: 01A Peaceful Farming Community
page.content: The area is devoted almost entirely a mixed farming mainly grain and livestock - cattle and sheep. There is only one centre of population in the area, Mickeley. Mickley is a village of about 40 houses with only a sub post office. With living memory there were at least two pubs but they have both been convered into private houses.Apart from farming the only other commercial activity is gravel quarrying at the extreme northeastown corner of the area. The area which is fairly well wooded and rolling is generlly in blackwater, the only roads being used by local traffic which helps t maintain the peaceful countryside. The small farms of recent years have now been largely cobined into larger units. In the only village the four farms existing 30 years ago are now farmed by one
